    • Constructor Detail

      • Connections

        public Connections()
        Making filename optional in case we want to addConnections directly.

      • Connections

        public Connections(java.lang.String filename)
        Reads each line from file into loadConnection function.
        Parameters:
        filename - example file data: "New York, California\nBoston, Philadelphia"

    • Method Detail

      • addConnection

        public void addConnection(java.lang.String city1,
                          java.lang.String city2)
        Saves connections in hashmap twice. Once in each direction.
        Parameters:
        city1 - either city. Order doesn't matter.
        city2 - either city. Order doesn't matter.

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected(java.lang.String currentCity,
                           java.lang.String destination,
                           java.util.Set<java.lang.String> avoidCities)
        We will be reading through the connectionMap to find connections. Note that connectionMap only has one layer of connections. So we are recursing through the layers to find deeper connections. If this function takes too long to recurse, we might save a cached version of the deep connections. Note that everything is saved in lowercase and compared in lowercase, to compare ignoring case.
        Parameters:
        currentCity - where are we coming from?
        destination - where are we trying to get to?
        avoidCities - what cities should I avoid traversing through?
        Returns:
        was a connection found?
